title: About
text: This website will serve as a place to gather my work, a living CV, and potentially a repository for thoughts too big for twitter.

text: This is a post with executable code.

title: CV
text:
RESEARCH EXPERIENCE

Senior Research Assistant | QUT | Jan 2022 – Present

Managed data curation, exploration, visualisation, and modelling across four separate projects
Analysed 16S metabarcoding data to investigate microbial markers of pasture dieback
Modelled diurnal fluctuations in bee hive temperature to isolate the relationship between colony strength and temperature regulation
Trained students and junior research assistants in the use of HPC infrastructure



Research Assistant | QUT | Mar 2020 – Jan 2022

Modelled the influence of bee colony strength on hive temperature
Used GC-MS and SIFT-MS methods to identify volatile compounds associated with mealybug-induced pasture dieback



Graduate Student | QUT | Feb 2017 – Oct 2020

Investigated patterns of phylosymbiosis in the microbiome of a native Australian stingless bee (Tetragonula carbonaria)
Provided bioinformatics and statistics expertise on collaborative projects including examining the genetic diversity of a threatened native Australian bat (Myotis Macropus)



Visiting Graduate Student | BOKU | Oct 2018 – Nov 2019

Developed tools for reproducible metabolomics research in R



Technical Assistant | QUT | Feb 2016 – Dec 2017

Contributed to collaborative projects developing fungal and viral biocontrol agents to manage invasive insect species
Maintained insect colonies, assisted with bioassays, cultured microorganisms, and used molecular techniques including PCR and gel electrophoresis



Vacation Research Student | QUT | Nov 2016 – Feb 2017, Nov 2015 – Feb 2016

Optimised and benchmarked open source and in-house amplicon metabarcoding pipelines
Automated video processing of behavioural assays and applied GC-MS technology to investigate the effects of fungal volatiles on beetle behaviour




PAPERS
        Cook, D., Tarlinton, B., McGree, J., Blackler, A., Hauxwell, C. (2022). Temperature sensing and honey bee colony strength. Journal of Economic Entomology, Volume 115, Issue 3, June 2022, Pages 715–723, https://doi.org/10.1093/jee/toac034


POSTERS AND CONFERENCE PRESENTATIONS
        Gorecki, V.*, Maggini, R., Tarlinton, B. and Hauxwell, C., Rhodes, M. and Parsons, S., Roost selection, roost availability and gene flow among culvert roosts of a trawling bat in a subtropical city. International Bat Research Conference, Austin, USA, 7-12 August, 2022.
        Gorecki, V.*, Tarlinton, B., Parsons, S., Rhodes, M. and Hauxwell, C. Population structure and gene flow among culvert roosts of the trawling bat, the large-footed Myotis Myotis macropus. Spoken presentation: 20th Australasian Bat Society Conference, Brisbane, Australia, 11-13 April, 2022.
        Gorecki, V.*, Parsons, S., Maggini, R., Rhodes, M., Tarlinton, B. and Hauxwell, C. Roost selection, roost availability and gene flow among culvert roosts of a trawling bat, the large-footed Myotis (Myotis macropus). Virtual 11th International Conference on Ecology and Transportation, 22-29 September, 2021.
        Gorecki, V.*, Maggini, R., Tarlinton, B., Hauxwell, C. and Parsons, S. The use of culverts in road networks as roost sites to maintain landscape connectivity for a trawling bat: a case study of the large-footed myotis (Myotis macropus) in Australia. Virtual Infrastructure and Ecology Network Europe, 12-14 January, 2021.
        Gorecki, V.*, Tarlinton, B., Parsons, S. and Hauxwell, C. Population structure and gene flow among culvert roosts of a specialist trawling bat in a subtropical city. Spoken presentation: Virtual Australasian Mammal Society Conference, 17- 18 November, 2020.
        Gorecki, V.*, Maggini, R., Tarlinton, B., Hauxwell, C., Rhodes, M. and Parsons, S. Roosting in road culverts: roost selection, roost availability and gene flow in a culvert roosting population of a trawling bat, the large-footed Myotis (Myotis macropus). Virtual 6th International Berlin Bat Meeting 23-27 March, 2020.
        Gorecki, V.*, Parsons, S., Maggini, R., Rhodes, M., Tarlinton, B., Hauxwell, C. From caves to culverts- roost selection and roosting ecology of the large-footed Myotis (Myotis macropus). Presented at ABS 2020, Te Anau, New Zealand, March 2020.
        Tarlinton, B.*, McGree, J., Gloag, R., Hauxwell, C. Bacterial diversity of the Tetragonula carbonaria microbiome within and between hives. Presented at SIP 2019, Valencia, July 2019.
    Hauxwell, C.*, Noune, C., Tarlinton, B., Mcgree, J. Baculoviruses as quasispecies: dynamics and selection in vivo. Presented at SIP 2018, Gold Coast, August 2018.
        Tarlinton, B.*, McGree, J., Hauxwell, C. Impacts of change of environment on the composition of microbiota in Australian stingless bees, Tetragonula carbonaria. Poster presented at SIP 2018, Gold Coast, August 2018.
Massaro, F., Gille, L.*, Tarlinton, B., Hauxwell, C. Yeasts associated with nests of Australian stingless bees (Meliponini). Poster Presented at SIP 2018, Gold Coast, August 2018.
        Tarlinton, B.*, Noune, C., Hauxwell, C. High-Resolution Termite Metagenomics. Poster presented at ABACBS 2016, Brisbane, November 2016.
* Presenting author


AWARDS AND SCHOLARSHIPS

First Place, SIP Student Poster Award | 2018
Endeavour Postgraduate Scholarship | 2018
QUT Vacation Research Experience Scholarship (x2) | 2015, 2016
QUT College of Excellence | 2016
Dean’s List, QUT Science and Engineering Faculty | Semester One, 2014



OTHER EXPERIENCE

Lab Demonstrator | QUT | Feb 2022 – June 2022

Mentored small groups of undergraduates through lab work and data analysis in a research-based environmental microbiology subject
Supported the transition to online teaching during the COVID-19 pandemic by developing new course materials
Assessed weekly lab reports and final poster presentations
Feb 2021 – May 2021 Feb 2020 – May 2020 Feb 2018 – May 2018 Feb 2017 – May 2017



Change Champion | QUT | May 2022 - Present

A service role supporting the rollout of new HR software in the Faculty of Science



AusSynBio Challenge Mentor | QUT | March 2022 – Present

Mentored



SEF Widening Participation Senior Ambassador | QUT | Jul 2018 – Sep 2018

Delivered engaging presentations and hands-on science workshops to school students, promoting diversity and higher education in STEM fields
Supervised and trained junior ambassadors



SEF Widening Participation Ambassador | QUT | Feb 2018 – Jul 2018


Note-taker | QUT | Feb 2014 – Nov 2016

Supported Equity Services at QUT by delivering thorough summaries of lectures, tutorials, and labs



Connect Session Facilitator | QUT | 2015 – 2016



MEMBERSHIPS

Member
Dec 2019 – Present

Associate Fellow
Jul 2018 – Present


Society for Invertebrate Pathology
Member
X - Present



Student Member
May 2018 – X


QUT SEF HDR Student Society Organising Committee
Member
Jun 2018 – Sep 2018

Founder, Co-President
Mar 2016 – Nov 2017

title: Boyd Tarlinton
text:
EDUCATION
Queensland University of Technology (QUT)

Master of Philosophy (Research) - QUT

Thesis: Phylosymbiosis and the microbiome of the native Australian stingless bee Tetragonula carbonaria
Supervisors: Associate Professor Caroline Hauxwell, Professor James McGree 2017 – 2021



Bachelor of Science (Chemistry) - QUT

Graduated with Distinction 2014 – 2016
